column3: str

<Emphasis>Dawn may banish even the darkest night,
Yet ever shall primal desires burn.</Emphasis>

<Emphasis>Two swords shall vie to lay them low─
A blade born of light and a blade forged of might.
Alas, man may entrust his fate unto but one.</Emphasis>
Truly, Archon Louisoix had a gift with words. Had circumstances been different, he would have made a magnificent minstrel...
You desire an encore? Very well, it would be my pleasure.
<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, I give you Ultima's Bane!

From an era long forgotten,♪
A blade of midnight drawn,♪
From a battlefield awakened,♪
A warrior who bears the dawn...♪

From an era long forgotten,♪
A blade of midnight drawn,♪
From a distant land uncharted,♪
A warrior who bears the dawn...♪
Ever since I first set foot in these lands, I have been haunted by a song.
It foretold the coming of the Seventh Umbral Era, and of those who would deliver us from doom...
Of course, I need not speak to you and your brethren of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes's words.
For in the fires of Carteneau, you witnessed the truth of the <Emphasis>Divine Chronicles</Emphasis>...
And when you emerged from the Praetorium triumphant, you proved yourself a Warrior of Light to the world once more.

<Emphasis>Ne'er till land consumes sun can sea bear moons,
Heavens spew crimson flame, hells seep black dooms.</Emphasis>

<Emphasis>Stray seeds quicken in ash's grey embrace,
Valiant blades forged under the Twelve's good grace.</Emphasis>
The words of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes─her <Emphasis>Divine Chronicles</Emphasis>, to be precise.
The “crimson flames” of Dalamud heralded the end of an era...
And the “valiant blades” of the Warriors of Light brought us hope in our darkest hour.

<Emphasis>Seven waning moons see seven suns rise,
Divine order roils, fallen corpses writhe.</Emphasis>

<Emphasis>Souls from aether far, strangers from strange lands,
Yester with thine eyes, morrow by thine hands.</Emphasis>
We knew not whom the verses spoke of─not I, nor the Archons, nor any other soul in the realm.
The Warriors of Light were lost to us. If not them, who could it be?
And then came the rumors of one not unlike them─a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who walked in the light of the Crystal.
From the moment I saw you, I felt it must be true. Having learned of your deeds in their entirety, I now <Emphasis>know</Emphasis> it to be true.
You are as they were, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─a Warrior of Light, and an inspiration to us all.
